title: Understanding Market Cap
content: Market Capitalization refers to the total dollar market value of a company's outstanding shares. Large-cap companies are generally safer, while small-cap companies offer higher risk and reward.

title: Moving Averages (SMA vs EMA)
content: A simple moving average (SMA) calculates the average of a selected range of prices, essentially smoothing out volatility. An exponential moving average (EMA) places greater weight on the most recent data.

title: P/E Ratio Explained
content: The Price-to-Earnings ratio measures a company's current share price relative to its per-share earnings. A high P/E could mean a stock's price is high relative to earnings and possibly overvalued.

title: RSI Indicator
content: The Relative Strength Index (RSI) is a momentum indicator used in technical analysis. An RSI above 70 indicates an asset is overbought, while an RSI below 30 indicates it is oversold.
